qas.question: What countries did they not settle in?

context: During and after the <a0_0>Greek War of Independence, <b5_0>Greeks of the diaspora were <a1_0><b6_0>important in establishing the fledgling state<b5_0/><a0_0/>, raising funds and awareness abroad<b6_0/><a1_0/>. <a2_0><b7_0>Greek merchant families<b7_0/> already had contacts in other countries<a2_0/> and during the disturbances many set up home around the Mediterranean (notably <a3_0><b8_0>Marseilles in France, Livorno in Italy, Alexandria in Egypt), Russia<b8_0/> (Odessa and Saint Petersburg), and Britain (London and Liverpool)<a3_0/> <a4_0>from where they traded, typically in textiles and grain.<a4_0/> Businesses frequently comprised the extended family, and with them they brought schools teaching Greek and the Greek Orthodox Church.
